Job Title: Program Financial Analyst

Location: University Park, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:

CURRENT PENN STATE EMPLOYEE (faculty, staff, technical service, or student), please login to Workday to complete the internal application process. Please do not apply here, apply internally through Workday. CURRENT PENN STATE STUDENT (not employed previously at the university) and seeking employment with Penn State, please login to Workday to complete the student application process. Please do not apply here, apply internally through Workday. If you are NOT a current employee or student, please click “Apply” and complete the application process for external applicants. 

JOB DESCRIPTION AND POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

The Financial Reporting Department at The Applied Research Laboratory (ARL) at Penn State is seeking a Program Financial Analyst to support the Materials and Manufacturing Office (MMO) Head and Office Business Manager (OBM) in the prioritization, coordination, and execution of MMO proposals. The Program Financial Analyst will work closely with the ARL Proposal Office and Contracts Office teams to ensure timely submission of compliant packages to sponsoring organizations.

ARL’s purpose is to research and develop innovative solutions to challenging scientific, engineering, and technology problems in support of the Navy, the Department of Defense (DoD), and the Intel Community (IC).

ARL is an authorized DoD SkillBridge partner and welcomes all transitioning military members to apply.

You will:

Support the MMO OBM in post award management and office manpower planningSupport MMO Principal Investigators (PIs) in the generation of Proposal Initiation FormsWork with the MMO PIs to determine the requirements of proposals per the solicitation, ARL and PSU guidelines, and FAR/DFAR requirementsCollaborate with the sponsoring organization to support identification of proposal requirements, due dates, and other applicable items associated with the proposal as neededCommunicate these requirements to the ARL Proposal and Contracts OfficesPrioritize timelines/schedules for individual proposal preparation and submission and hold the proposal team accountablePrioritize MMO proposals using a variety of factors to include but not limited to due date, complexity factor, and realismWork with the MMO Office Head to resolve any issues, and communicate the priorities to the ARL Proposal OfficeSupport the MMO OBM in post award management by meeting with MMO Principal Investigators and Division Heads to review project expenditures, risks, forecasting, and contractual needs/requirementsReview MMO Project expenditures and balances to ensure risk of project over/under run are mitigatedGenerate MMO manpower utilization reports using Estimate to Complete budgets and proposals weighted on their assigned probabilitySupport the use of this data for financial forecasting, resource de-confliction, hiring decisions, and to support inter-division resource utilization

Minimally requires a Bachelor’s degree or higher plus three years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Required skills and experience include:

Accounting, budgeting, forecasting and variance analysis

Preferred skills and experience include: 

A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business ManagementProject management and project costing on government contracts

Your working location will hybrid (remote/on-site), located in State College, PA.

ARL at Penn State is an integral part of one of the leading research universities in the nation and serves as a University center of excellence in defense science, systems, and technologies with a focus in naval missions and related areas.

You will be subject to a government security investigation, and you must be a U.S. citizen to apply. Employment with the ARL will require successful completion of a pre-employment drug screen.

ARL is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion; we believe this is central to our success as a Department of Defense designated University Affiliated Research Center (UARC). We are at our best when we draw on the talents of all parts of society, and our greatest accomplishments are achieved when diverse perspectives are part of our workforce.

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION on ARL, visit our web site at www.arl.psu.edu.

The salary range for this position, including all possible grades is:

$61,800.00 - $89,600.00

Salary Structure - additional information on Penn State's job and salary structure.

CAMPUS SECURITY CRIME STATISTICS: 

Pursuant to the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act and the Pennsylvania Act of 1988, Penn State publishes a combined Annual Security and Annual Fire Safety Report (ASR). The ASR includes crime statistics and institutional policies concerning campus security, such as those concerning alcohol and drug use, crime prevention, the reporting of crimes, sexual assault, and other matters. The ASR is available for review here.

Employment with the University will require successful completion of background check(s) in accordance with University policies.

EEO IS THE LAW

Penn State is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you are unable to use our online application process due to an impairment or disability, please contact 814-865-1473.
